required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SPYRAL PIVOTAL - SPYRAL HTN-OFF MED Study
clinical_study.official_title: Global Clinical Study of Renal Denervation With the Symplicity Spyral™ Multi-electrode Renal Denervation System in Patients With Uncontrolled Hypertension in the Absence of Antihypertensive Medications (SPYRAL PIVOTAL - SPYRAL HTN-OFF MED)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the hypothesis that renal denervation decreases blood pressure and is safe when studied in the absence of antihypertensive medications.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Major Adverse Events (MAE) Defined as a Composite of Events.
primary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality End-stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Significant embolic event resulting in end-organ damage Renal artery perforation requiring intervention Renal artery dissection requiring intervention Vascular complications Hospitalization for hypertensive crisis not related to confirmed non-adherence with medications or the protocol New renal artery stenosis >70% (6 months for new renal artery stenosis, however endpoint data is reported to 3 months only)

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Adjusted Change (Using Analysis of Covariance) in Systolic Blood Pressure as Measured by 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure is the change in ambulatory systolic blood pressure from baseline to 3-month. The unadjusted treatment difference between renal denervation and sham control groups is -3.9 mmHg. The baseline adjusted treatment difference is -3.9 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Adjusted Change (Using Analysis of Covariance) in Office Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome measure is the change in office systolic blood pressure from baseline to 3-month. The unadjusted treatment difference between renal denervation and sham control groups is -7.0 mmHg. The baseline adjusted treatment difference is -6.9 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Significant Embolic Event Resulting in End-organ Damage
secondary_outcome.description: Significant embolic event resulting in end-organ damage (e.g. kidney/bowel infarct, lower extremity ulceration or gangrene, or doubling of serum creatinine documented by at least two measurements at least 21 days apart)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Renal Artery Perforation Requiring Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Renal artery perforation requiring intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal Artery Dissection
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with Renal artery dissection requiring intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vascular Complications
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular complications (e.g., clinically significant groin hematoma, arteriovenous fistula, pseudoaneurysm, excessive bleeding) requiring surgical repair, interventional procedure, thrombin injection, or blood transfusion (requiring more than 2 units of packed red blood cells within any 24 hour period during the first 7 days post renal denervation procedure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With End-stage Renal Disease
secondary_outcome.description: defined as two or more eGFR measurements < 15 mL/min/1.73m2 at least 21 days apart and requiring dialysis for one of more of the following: Volume management refractory to diuretics Hyperkalemia unmanageable by diet and diuretics Acidosis bicarbonate <18 unmanageable with HCO3 supplements Symptoms of uremia, nausea, vomiting

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Decline in eGFR
secondary_outcome.description: ≥40% decline in eGFR

secondary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Infarction
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with New myocardial infarction

secondary_outcome.measure: New Stroke
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants with New stroke

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Renal Artery Re-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Renal artery re-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Major Bleeding According to TIMI Definition
secondary_outcome.description: Major bleeding according to TIMI definition (i.e. intracranial hemorrhage, ≥5g/dl decrease in hemoglobin concentration, a ≥15% absolute decrease in hematocrit, or death due to bleeding within 7 days of the procedure).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Increase in Serum Creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: Increase in serum creatinine > 50% from screening visit 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With New Renal Artery Stenosis > 70%
secondary_outcome.description: Confirmed by angiography and as determined by the angiographic core laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hospitalization for Hypertensive Crisis With Medications or the Protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Hospitalization for hypertensive crisis not related to confirmed non-adherence with medications or the protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With All-cause Mortality
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause mortality

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in Systolic Blood Pressure as Measured by 24-hour ABPM
Number of Participants With Incidence of Achieving Target Office Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP <140 mmHg)
Number of Participants With Change in Office Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in office diastolic blood pressure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure as Measured by 24-hour ABPM
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diastolic blood pressure as measured by 24-hour ABPM

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months post randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as two or more eGFR measurements < 15 mL/min/1.73m2 at least 21 days apart and requiring dialysis for one of more of the following: Volume management refractory to diuretics Hyperkalemia unmanageable by diet and diuretics Acidosis bicarbonate <18 unmanageable with HCO3 supplements Symptoms of uremia, nausea, vomiting

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Target Office Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 1 month post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of achieving target office systolic blood pressure (SBP <140 mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Target Office Systolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Achieving Target Office Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP <140 mmHg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Office Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 1 month post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in office diastolic blood pressure from baseline (Screening Visit 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Office Diastolic Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Office Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline (Screening Visit 2) to 3-months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure as Measured by 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in diastolic blood pressure from baseline (screening visit 2) to 3-month as measured by 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM).

arm_group.description: Renal angiography and Renal Denervation (Symplicity Spyral™ multi-electrode renal denervation system)

intervention.intervention_name: Symplicity Spyral™ multi-electrode renal denervation system
intervention.description: After a renal angiography according to standard procedures, subjects remain blinded and are immediately treated with the renal denervation procedure after randomization.
After a renal angiography according to standard procedures, subjects remain blinded and remain on the catheterization lab table for at least 20 minutes prior to introducer sheath removal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individual has office systolic blood pressure (SBP) ≥ 150 mmHg and <180 mmHg and a diastolic blood pressure (DBP) ≥ 90 mmHg after being off medications.
- Individual has 24-hour Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring (ABPM) average SBP ≥ 140 mmHg and < 170 mmHg.
- Individual is willing to discontinue current antihypertensive medications.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individual lacks appropriate renal artery anatomy.
- Individual has estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) of <45.
- Individual has type 1 diabetes mellitus or poorly-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus.
- Individual has one or more episodes of orthostatic hypotension.
- Individual requires chronic oxygen support or mechanical ventilation other than nocturnal respiratory support for sleep apnea.
- Individual has primary pulmonary hypertension.
- Individual is pregnant, nursing or planning to become pregnant.
- Individual has frequent intermittent or chronic pain that results in treatment with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for two or more days per week over the month prior to enrollment.
- Individual has stable or unstable angina within 3 months of enrollment, myocardial infarction within 3 months of enrollment; heart failure, cerebrovascular accident or transient ischemic attack, or atrial fibrillation at any time.
- Individual works night shifts.

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania
Institut de cardiologie de Montréal / Montreal Heart Institute
Cardiff and Vale University Health Board - University Hospital of Wales
Royal Devon & Exeter NHS Foundation Trust

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
